text.name: description
text.text: The Megadrive was Sega's third console and the successor to the Master System. The main microprocessor of the Megadrive is a 16/32-bit Motorola 68000 CPU clocked at 7.6 MHz. The console also includes a Zilog Z80 sub-processor, which was mainly used to control the sound hardware and also provides backwards compatibility with the Master System.
